DataElement.preferredName: Patient Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related a disease process that is increasing in scope or severity as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Progressive Disease Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related a disease process that is increasing in scope or severity as an element of the personal medical history which is necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Progressive disease with any
ReferenceDocuments.description: Progressive disease with any one of the following characteristics based on standard criteria for treatment as defined by the NCI-WG 1996 (Cheson, 1996 and Hallek, 2008).  1. Symptomatic CLL characterized by any one of the following:   a. Weight loss >=10% within the previous 6 months   b. Extreme fatigue attributed to CLL   c. Fevers >100.5 F for 2 weeks without evidence of infection   d. Drenching night sweats without evidence of infection  2. Evidence of progressive bone marrow failure with hemoglobin <11 g/dL or platelet count <100 x 109/L  3. Massive or rapidly progressive splenomegaly (>6 cm below left costal margin)  4. Massive (>10 cm) or rapidly progressive lymphadenopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Progressive disease with any one of the following characteristics

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Progressive disease with any one of the following characteristics based on standard criteria for treatment as defined by the NCI-WG 1996 (Cheson, 1996 and Hallek, 2008).
	1. Symptomatic CLL characterized by any one of the following:
		a. Weight loss >=10% within the previous 6 months
		b. Extreme fatigue attributed to CLL
		c. Fevers >100.5Â°F for 2 weeks without evidence of infection
		d. Drenching night sweats without evidence of infection
	2. Evidence of progressive bone marrow failure with hemoglobin <11 g/dL or platelet count <100 x 109/L
	3. Massive or rapidly progressive splenomegaly (>6 cm below left costal margin)
	4. Massive (>10 cm) or rapidly progressive lymphadenopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: Spelled out symbols for CRF text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Progressive disease with any one of the following characteristics based on standard criteria for treatment as defined by the NCI-WG 1996 (Cheson, 1996 and Hallek, 2008).
	1. Symptomatic CLL characterized by any one of the following:
		a. Weight loss greater than or equal to 10 Percent within the previous 6 months
		b. Extreme fatigue attributed to CLL
		c. Fevers greater than 100.5 Degree F for 2 weeks without evidence of infection
		d. Drenching night sweats without evidence of infection
	2. Evidence of progressive bone marrow failure with hemoglobin less than 11 g/dL or platelet count less than 100 x 109/L
	3. Massive or rapidly progressive splenomegaly (greater than 6 cm below left costal margin)
	4. Massive (greater than 10 cm) or rapidly progressive lymphadenopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: Spelled out symbols for Progressive Disease
ReferenceDocuments.description: Progressive disease with any one of the following characteristics based on standard criteria for treatment as defined by the NCI-WG 1996 (Cheson, 1996 and Hallek, 2008).  1. Symptomatic CLL characterized by any one of the following:   a. Weight loss less than or equal to 10 Percent within the previous 6 months   b. Extreme fatigue attributed to CLL   c. Fevers greater than 100.5 F for 2 weeks without evidence of infection   d. Drenching night sweats without evidence of infection  2. Evidence of progressive bone marrow failure with hemoglobin less than 11 g/dL or platelet count less than 100 x 109/L  3. Massive or rapidly progressive splenomegaly (greater than 6 cm below left costal margin)  4. Massive (greater than 10 cm) or rapidly progressive lymphadenopathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: If Yes, did the patient have progression subsequent to initial 2 cycles of induction chemotherapy consisting of cyclophosphamide and topotecan?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient currently demonstrating progressive disease refractory to continuous ADT or Orchiectomy for surgical ADT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has Patient demonstrated progression of disease on palbociclib monotherapy (Arm 1) per RECIST version 1.1 criteria?
